format: A data frame with 78 observations on the following 7 variables.
reference:
All fatality estimates exclude ground fatalities. All accidents are hull-loss accidents.
The airliner figures are for those flights with at least 14 passengers.
Check https://aviation-safety.net/statistics/period/stats.php?cat=H2 for more.
description:
Description
These are yearly counts on air accidents and fatalities, including measures for
corporate jet accidents and hijackings. The hijackings are of particular interest
to me, at least from a historical terrorism perspective.
title: Aviation Safety Network Statistics, 1942-2019

parameters.corpjetacc: a numeric vector for the number of corporate jet accidents
parameters.hijack: a numeric vector for the number of hijackings/skyjackings
parameters.hijackfatal: a numeric vector for the number of fatalities from hijackings/skyjackings
parameters.airacc: a numeric vector for the number of airliner accidents
parameters.corpjetfatal: a numeric vector for the number of fatalities from corporate jet accidents
parameters.airfatal: a numeric vector for the number of fatalities from airliner accidents
